posts.post_content:
While it's mostly better than o-ring, the only really consistent thing this will do better than o-ring is hit tokens that put many into play at once. With bonfire still running rampant, that shouldn't happen too often in standard.  
  
If you have the money then this is worth it over o-ring, but at the same time if it's out of your budget it's still okay to run o-ring.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Notice the cost of both this and o-ring fall under[abrupt decay](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=abrupt decay)s reach. I think that had to happen to secure golgari's spot as number one.
  
   
either way I love this card, with [supreme verdict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=supreme verdict) and counterspells, U/W has some neat tricks.
  
   
Ooo... Combine this card and o-ring, arrest, [ethereal armor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=ethereal armor) and [righteous authority](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=righteous authority), plus some detain effects( [martial law](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=martial law) anyone?) and protection... I can see that deck getting very out of hand.
posts.html:
Notice the cost of both this and o-ring fall underabrupt decays reach. I think that had to happen to secure golgari's spot as number one.

either way I love this card, with supreme verdict and counterspells, U/W has some neat tricks.

posts.post_content:
@Amorgan  
  
*No one here has stated that this can be used as a MASSIVE Tutor combo card.  
  
Think about casting this on YOUR OWN Blade Splicer, so now you kill your Sphere and all the sudden you just got 4 3/3 First Strikers and 4 1/1s.  
  
Not good enough? How about Geist-Honored Monk? Anyone want 4 12/12 Vigilance and 8 1/1s ?*  
  
Sorry bro, but nobody has mentioned any mass tutor tricks because, well, this card doesn't work that way. A permanent is only a permanent when it is in play on the battlefield, otherwise it is a card. Detention Sphere only exiles permanents on the battlefield with the same name, similar to [Echoing Truth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Echoing Truth). There is no search the library clause like on [Eradicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eradicate). If it did work that way though it would be pretty broken like you said, but then the situations where you would want to use this card on an opponents permanent would drop significantly. Oh well, better luck next time ;)  
  
@Axelle

posts.post_content:
Lets just say for the sake of a good example that your opponent has 97 nonland permanents on the battlefield all having different names, and you have 3 oblivion rings on the battlefield exiling 3 of your opponents nonland permanents, again, all with different names. You have to find a way to get rid of every single one of those nonland permanents before your next turn. In hand you have 2 cards, Detention Sphere and Oblivion Ring.   
  
Play Detention Sphere exiling your 3 oblivion rings.  
Play Oblivion Ring exiling Detention Sphere.  
3 O-Ring ETB triggers go on the stack.  
1st O-Ring exiles another of the 3 O-Rings.  
Exiled O-Ring's leave play ability goes on stack and resolves with nothing coming back because it hadn't exiled anything yet.  
Exiled O-Ring's ETB trigger exiles a nonland permanent, permanently.  
3rd O-Ring triggers exiling the O-Ring that exiled the Detention Sphere.  
Detention Sphere exiles two O-Rings, bringing back 2 O-Rings.  
1 O-Ring exiles a nonland permanent, the other exiles... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Lets just say for the sake of a good example that your opponent has 97 nonland permanents on the battlefield all having different names, and you have 3 oblivion rings on the battlefield exiling 3 of your opponents nonland permanents, again, all with different names. You have to find a way to get rid of every single one of those nonland permanents before your next turn. In hand you have 2 cards, Detention Sphere and Oblivion Ring.

Play Detention Sphere exiling your 3 oblivion rings.
Play Oblivion Ring exiling Detention Sphere.
3 O-Ring ETB triggers go on the stack.
1st O-Ring exiles another of the 3 O-Rings.
Exiled O-Ring's leave play ability goes on stack and resolves with nothing coming back because it hadn't exiled anything yet.
Exiled O-Ring's ETB trigger exiles a nonland permanent, permanently.
3rd O-Ring triggers exiling the O-Ring that exiled the Detention Sphere.
Detention Sphere exiles two O-Rings, bringing back 2 O-Rings.
1 O-Ring exiles a nonland permanent, the other exiles... (see all)

I run two of these in my casual u/w deck. Like many have already said this card works best against combo and tribal decks. And if you're already playing u/w you might as well replace Oblivion Ring with this. posts.post_content: One advantage this has over [Oblivion Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oblivion Ring) is that when your opponent responds with an overloaded [Mizzium Skin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mizzium Skin) or [Simic Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Simic Charm), you can choose not to exile a permanent of your own, whereas with Oblivion Ring you must target one of your own permanents. Then again this isn't a terribly likely occurrence, but it has happened before.
posts.html:

Then again this isn't a terribly likely occurrence, but it has happened before.
